formSteps.title: Starting Position
formSteps.description: Start in a plank position and set the correct positions for your hands and feet.

formSteps.title: Descending Motion
formSteps.description: Bend your elbows and slowly lower your body down.
keyPoints: Lower until chest nearly touches floor

formSteps.title: Bottom Position
formSteps.description: Pause briefly at the bottom position where your chest nearly touches the floor.
keyPoints: Fist-width gap between chest and floor

formSteps.title: Ascending Motion
formSteps.description: Push back up to the starting position by extending your arms.

formSteps.title: Finish Position
formSteps.description: Return completely to starting position and prepare for the next repetition.

commonMistakes.title: Hips too high
commonMistakes.description: Raising your hips too high reduces core muscle engagement and decreases effectiveness.
corrections: Engage core muscles to maintain straight line
Practice plank position to build foundation

commonMistakes.title: Sagging hips
commonMistakes.description: Sagging hips puts strain on the lower back and increases injury risk.

commonMistakes.title: Elbows flared too wide
commonMistakes.description: Flaring elbows to 90 degrees puts stress on shoulders and increases injury risk.
corrections: Keep elbows close to body (45-degree angle)

commonMistakes.title: Head forward
commonMistakes.description: Pushing your head forward creates tension in neck and shoulders and breaks proper form.

commonMistakes.title: Partial range of motion
commonMistakes.description: Not lowering enough significantly reduces muscle development benefits.
corrections: Lower until chest nearly touches floor

variations.name: Knee Push-ups
variations.description: Beginner push-ups performed with knees on the ground
instructions: Keep straight line from knees to head

variations.name: Incline Push-ups
variations.description: Push-ups using bench or stairs for elevation
instructions: Place hands on bench or stairs
Perform same motion as regular push-ups

variations.name: Diamond Push-ups
variations.description: Advanced push-ups with hands in diamond shape
instructions: Form diamond shape with hands under chest
Create triangle with thumbs and index fingers

variations.name: One-Arm Push-ups
variations.description: Maximum difficulty push-ups using only one arm

improvementTips.title: Proper Breathing Pattern
improvementTips.description: Maximize exercise effectiveness and improve endurance through proper breathing.

improvementTips.title: Progressive Overload
improvementTips.description: Gradually increase intensity for continuous strength development.

improvementTips.title: Proper Rest and Recovery
improvementTips.description: Promote muscle growth and prevent injury through adequate rest.

improvementTips.title: Goal Setting and Tracking
improvementTips.description: Maintain consistent motivation through clear goals and progress tracking.

quizQuestions.question: Where should your hands be positioned in the correct push-up starting position?
quizQuestions.explanation: Hands should be directly under shoulders to maintain stable form.

quizQuestions.question: What is the most common push-up mistake?
quizQuestions.explanation: Raising hips too high reduces core muscle engagement and decreases exercise effectiveness.

quizQuestions.question: Which push-up variation is most suitable for beginners?
quizQuestions.explanation: Knee push-ups have lower injury risk and are great for learning proper form.

quizQuestions.question: What is the correct breathing technique for push-ups?
options: Exhale going down, inhale going up
Inhale going down, exhale going up
quizQuestions.explanation: Inhaling while going down and exhaling while going up is the correct breathing technique.

quizQuestions.question: What is the correct elbow angle in push-ups?
quizQuestions.explanation: Keeping elbows at 45 degrees prevents shoulder injury and enables effective exercise.

quizQuestions.question: What is the role of core muscles in push-ups?
quizQuestions.explanation: Core muscles play a key role in maintaining proper form by keeping the body in a straight line.

quizQuestions.question: How can you prevent the mistake of head forward during push-ups?
quizQuestions.explanation: Looking at the floor naturally keeps the neck in a neutral position.

quizQuestions.question: Which is the most difficult push-up variation for advanced practitioners?
quizQuestions.explanation: One-arm push-ups have the highest difficulty as you must support body weight with only one arm.
